description: islands with teal trees and mountains; two cranes at left in a small clearing; orange, yellow and white buildings; figure wearing yellow garment and salmon-colored hood walking with a white deer at bottom of third panel from left; two figures--one wearing white garment and yellow hood, the other wearing a small black cap, blue shirt and yellow pants--on a path at bottom of third panel from left; two figures seated in a small courtyard--one wearing white with yellow hood, one wearing pale blue--at bottom of second panel from right; inscription and seal in LLC
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair
text: According to Daoism, in the seas off China’s east coast are the three paradisiacal isles: Hōko (Square Kettle; Ch.: Fanghu), Hōrai (Ch.: Penglai), and Eishū (Sea Island; Ch.: Yingzhou). The height and perimeter of each mountain is 15,000 km, and one could supposedly find pills of immortality there, but the mountainous islands were unreachable by mankind and all expeditions in search of them failed.
title: The Three Paradisiacal Isles [left of a pair]
